chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
ptd: SF_seq

Goal:
pointed_subdiv ptd -> SF_sorted Rle ptd

Premises:
pointed_subdiv = fun ptd : SF_seq => forall i : nat, (i < SF_size ptd)%nat -> nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_ly ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) (S i) : SF_seq -> Prop
Rle = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 < r2 \/ r1 = r2 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
SF_sorted = fun (T : Type) (Ord : R -> R -> Prop) (s : SF_seq) => sorted Ord (SF_lx s) : forall T : Type, (R -> R -> Prop) -> SF_seq -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _]
ptd_cons : forall (h : R * R) (s : SF_seq), pointed_subdiv (SF_cons h s) -> pointed_subdiv s
SF_map_sort : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (s : SF_seq) (Ord : R -> R -> Prop), SF_sorted Ord s -> SF_sorted Ord (SF_map f s) where ?T : [ptd : SF_seq |- Type] ?T0 : [ptd : SF_seq |- Type]
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> seq (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> seq (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
constant_D_eq = fun (f : R -> R) (D : R -> Prop) (c : R) => forall x : R, D x -> f x = c : (R -> R) -> (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope]
included = fun D1 D2 : R -> Prop => forall x : R, D1 x -> D2 x : (R -> Prop) -> (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope]
primitive : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R), a <= b -> (forall x : R, a <= x -> x <= b -> Riemann_integrable f a x) -> R -> R
intersection_domain = fun (D1 D2 : R -> Prop) (c : R) => D1 c /\ D2 c : (R -> Prop) -> (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope]
Heine : forall (f : R -> R) (X : R -> Prop), compact X -> (forall x : R, X x -> continuity_pt f x) -> uniform_continuity f X
ssr_have : forall Plemma Pgoal : Type, Plemma -> (Plemma -> Pgoal) -> Pgoal
eq_Dom = fun D1 D2 : R -> Prop => included D1 D2 /\ included D2 D1 : (R -> Prop) -> (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope]
derivable_pt_abs = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : R) => derivable_pt_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope R_scope]
antiderivative = fun (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) => (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> exists pr : derivable_pt g x, f x = derive_pt g x pr) /\ a <= b : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope]
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> x <= m : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
is_subdivision = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (l : Rlist) => {l0 : Rlist & adapted_couple f a b l l0} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rlist -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope _]
FTC_P1 : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R), a <= b -> (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> continuity_pt f x) -> forall x : R, a <= x -> x <= b -> Riemann_integrable f a x
compact_eqDom : forall X1 X2 : R -> Prop, compact X1 -> X1 =_D X2 -> compact X2
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
compact = fun X : R -> Prop => forall f : family, covering_open_set X f -> exists D : R -> Prop, covering_finite X (subfamily f D) : (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
IsStepFun = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => {l : Rlist & is_subdivision f a b l} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
derivable_pt_lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : R) => forall eps : R, 0 < eps -> exists delta : posreal, forall h : R, h <> 0 -> Rabs h < delta -> Rabs ((f (x + h) - f x) / h - l) < eps : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope _]
covering = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f0 : family) => forall x : R, D x -> exists y : R, f0 y x : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
continuity_pt = fun (f : R -> R) (x0 : R) => continue_in f no_cond x0 : (R -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
covering_finite = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f : family) => covering D f /\ family_finite f : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
covering_open_set = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f : family) => covering D f /\ family_open_set f : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Rlist_ind : forall P : Rlist -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (r : R) (r0 : Rlist), P r0 -> P (cons r r0)) -> forall r : Rlist, P r
derivable_pt = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => {l : R | derivable_pt_abs f x l} : (R -> R) -> R -> Set Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
neighbourhood = fun (V : R -> Prop) (x : R) => exists delta : posreal, included (disc x delta) V : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
